clinical_study.brief_title: Ocular Coil Drug Delivery Comfort Trial
clinical_study.official_title: Evaluation of the Safety and Tolerability of an Ocular Coil

brief_summary.textblock: The Ocular Coil is intended to provide drug delivery to the ocular surface. This study will evaluate the safety and tolerability of the placebo Ocular Coil in healthy subjects.

detailed_description.textblock: This study is designed to evaluate the safety and comfort of a placebo Ocular Coil for 28 days in 40 healthy subjects.

primary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in terms of ocular irritation
primary_outcome.description: Ocular irritation is assessed by slit lamp microscopy through evaluation of the ocular redness, inflammatory cells and flare.

secondary_outcome.measure: Total time of Ocular Coil retention
secondary_outcome.description: The total number of days that the Ocular Coil is worn by the participant (from placement until removal) is recorded.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants in Each Response Category of Subject Comfort
secondary_outcome.description: Subject comfort is assessed via a custom-made questionnaire. This questionnaire includes several questions related to eye comfort (itchy feeling, foreign feeling, etc.) and uses a 5-point scale (from agree to do not agree) and a 4-point scale (from always to never). The percentage of participants in each response category is recorded.
Incidence of ocular adverse events related to the Ocular Coil or the associated procedures (placement and removal) is evaluated.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Age between 18 and 75 years old
- Informed and having given informed consent
- Willing and able to comply with scheduled visits and other study procedures
Exclusion Criteria:
- Subjects with a history of eye disease that can make them vulnerable for irritation by the coil.
- Subjects wearing contact lenses (unless they are willing to replace them for glasses for the duration of the study).
- Subjects using eye drops (during the study).
- Subjects with an Oriental/Asian lid crease, because of their narrow fornix.
- Subjects who do not speak and/or write Dutch properly.
- Subjects with a history of serious adverse reaction or hypersensitivity to components of the ocular coil. or to ophthalmic anaesthetics
- Women who are pregnant or nursing their child, or have the intention to become pregnant during the course of the study.
